It would be awesome to have a ranged golem in Minecraft! But how would it deal with crowds of mobs? Maybe it would have a sweeping attack with their trident when mobs get too close which deals small damage but knocks them backwards (and far away) instead of into the air like the iron golem.

Cool idea for lore, although I feel like maybe there should be a few other things he does other than that. Maybe he has a chance of trading rare heroes artifacts from legend. Or items to help you along your quest. For the ender dragon story I think it should also say how to beat him. Perhaps even some especially rare books, such as the ender dragon book, and the wither book. Another especially rare book may be a story about Notch. One last thing what if there was a Herobrine horror story but the chance of him trading that was like 0.1 %. But if you get it and read through you may have a few interesting encounters for the next few minecraft days until they eventually stop for no reason. I don't necessarily mean obvious encounters, but subtle ones. Although subtle enough to completely go unnoticed.

The forgotten could be very creepy. Maybe they don't make any sound at all, unless you disturb them or thier home. Then they will wait until you are out of sight, after which you would hear many of them scream in the distance and you know they are coming.

I do want them to be a little creepy, and I agree that their creepiness should be reflected in the sounds they make. I am not sure about the screaming, though. They seem a little more sad and reflective than the rest of the undead, so I do like the silence idea. Maybe they could rarely grunt in a sadder tone than a normal zombified piglin, and have a deep grunt/roar when they attack.
i actually really like this! it just sounds so... minecrafty
oh and it would scare the crap out of piglins

Because it is easier to get books of higher levels that what librarians offer, from an enchanting table; I think all the master level books should be locked as the highest value enchantment. E.G. a desert villager should give Efficiency 5 instead of Efficiency 3. (It is much easier to get efficiency 4 with an enchanting table than looking for a dessert and trading a villager to its master level only to get a worse book)

I dislike the new trading system because it take away the players ability to play the game the way they want to. Maybe some of the map changes could be nice to find other things in the world. This is a game breaker for me with these changes, and I have already stopped playing on my realm until they decide if they are going thru with this. Hope they keep player freedom and choice in mind when deciding.

My Ideas for New Villagers Jobs:

Pyrotechnic:
Trades: Fireworks, gumpowder and TNT.
Work station: Pyrotechnic table (New block).

Baker:
Trades: Breads, cookies, cakes, pies.
Work Station: Culinary table (New block).

Beekeeper:
Trades: Honey, flowers, candles.
Work station: Beehive

Ceramist:
Trades: Clay, flower pots, future archeology related stuff.
Work station: Kiln (New block).

Carpenter:
Trades: Sapplings, wood building blocks.
Work station: Woodcutter (New block).

Rancher:
Trades: Leads, crates with Animals (Mod: Villagers Sell Animals).
Work station: Feeding trough (New block).

Redstone Engenner Villagers are rejected.

This concept requires a lot of balancing since the player can control job site blocks and the village mechanics.  What unique task would you have the player do?
This is a great idea and could open a lot of options for trading. This would especially help if they connect different biomes villages (because different villages have different focuses).

I fully support this idea, although I am still in favor of having a setup in the peace generator that you can extend these roads up to the farthest villages and they should all form a network.
I want to add that to the existing idea. You can add a wagon train or a cart. To have a mobile base with chests.
This will realize the very feeling of traveling through minecraft, which was so much missed.

It is worth noting that it is also worth making paths coming from the main trails to the dungeons, as to places of interest. This will allow you not to use the dungeon web map.

I also want the best processing of dungeons with spawners.The text size exceeds the maximum

And an Alex Husk, and an Alex Drowned too.

(50/50 Chance, just a visual change. But there would also be an Alex textured Zombie Head too).
Y m√°s mobs como Alex
But what happens when you place down a chest and the villagers see you open that. It's alright with piglins but not villagers.
I'm with Darknessfrog. It seems like a bad idea since we're the ones who would be building cities and stuff for the villagers to live in.

I don't quite like this idea for three reasons:

1.) The chests are using a random loot table so as to encourage the player to explore villages. It's not exactly stealing.

2.) As others have said, what happens if we are building a new village or rebuilding an old one? Either villagers would act like every chest is theirs (which is bad) or the game would have to store the coordinate of the spawned chest and give it a unique ID so that villagers know that any chest at that location is theirs, but then after tearing down the village and building a new one in it's place they'd have that behavior if you happen to drop a chest at that coordinate at some point in the future OR you'd never be able to let a village see you open any chest anywhere ever again. Depending on which way it's implemented, of course. Either way it's bad.

3.) If opening that chest resulted in an iron golem being called it would be royally abused. All you'd need to do is attach a few hoppers to it, have a death trap surrounding it, and every time you open it a golem will spawn then die then give you iron. Not that automatic golem farms don't already exist, but that would make it possible to do with significantly less resources.
I think it‚Äôs a good idea. You should not ever steal.
It seems like that should have been the plan from the start. It gives players a challenge when they get to the village!
This should be a toggle, and they should only get mad if you open chests generated by villages.
if you want more diverse skins, there are texture packs

There are no NPCs why should there be black NPCs.

If you want a black skin you can make one and submit it to the marketplace.

Villagers don't have races, mojang has already ruled on this.
Shouldn't they actually add human npcs first ? Villagers are a completely different type of species. If they add human npcs like Steve and Alex this would fit perfectly .
Stop bringing race into this. Mojang stated that villagers are raceless. Leave politics out of this, its a game you mason.

I learned recently that villagers are unfortunate caricatures of Jewish folks (big noses, golems, etc. etc.). Not great. Seeing as that is where the villagers are, I do not see any progress going ahead in terms of properly implementing useful and appropriate in-game diversity. It is not great, but I think the suggestion of downloading a texture pack is going to be our best bet here until Mojang seriously re-considers its villager graphics :/

NPCs don't have specific races. Mojang confirmed this. We do not need to have politics interfering with the game we use as a place to forget about said politics. I believe that minecraft should retain its classic, nostalgic style that this would shatter. What was put in by the developers before everything had to be accepting should be cherished as the last sanctuary before chaos ruled the world.
Maybe a new type of astronomer villager?
The Astronomer are villagers, but they don't live in villages. They are the residents of the Observatory (see link above).
They should also have some new type of golem to defend them maybe a clock work golem or something
YES. We need this for other mobs!
What about cat collars? Would it do the same? I totally love this idea!
This should also apply to cat collars and live shulker shells.
villagers shouldn't claim workstations and beds they can't path to.

I like this idea so much! I really want this idea to be added, but alas, the rules say that Villagers are not ever gonna be able to harm the player. *Sigh*.

"Keep in mind, villagers are just traders and that's all they want to do. They don't want to fight, or build, or do anything but live and let live. They're pretty chill."

Smarter NPCs (Consequences, making enemies. etc.) DETAILED

Yes, this would definitely make the game more fun. If villagers were to fight back and allow themselves to be recruited.
